intro: Eriogonum oblanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. Eriogonum oblanceolatum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
